posts.name: Blue Star Donuts
posts.note: This upmarket brioche-donut bakery features creative flavors and organic, locally sourced ingredients.

posts.name: Bunk Sandwiches
posts.note: Bunk's signature sandwiches  - such as the Pork Belly Cubano, the Meatball Parmiagano Hero, and the Pulled Pork with Apple Cabbage Slaw - have garnered national media attention.

posts.name: Chicken and Guns
posts.note: They serve Oak Fired Latin Chicken.  We only use naturally raised chicken from Scratch Farms in Canby, OR.

posts.name: The Fried Onion *
posts.note: NYC street food - Moussa is a fried onions, roasted red peppers, buffalo chicken, and pastrami sandwich.

posts.name: Grilled Cheese Grill *
posts.note: Hopping eatery housed in a converted school bus serving creative spins on the grilled cheese.

posts.name: Interurban *
posts.note: Bustling 2-story saloon with retro hardwood decor serving craft cocktails and upscale bar snacks.

posts.name: Kenny & Zuke's Delicatessen *
posts.note: Bustling spot serving a signature pastrami, bagels and other deli fare in a roomy, light-filled space. You need to order the Jeremy which is Mac and cheese with pastrami.

posts.name: Kim Jong Grillin’
posts.note: Possibly the best-named cart ever, with addictive Korean street food.

posts.name: Lardo
posts.note: Former food truck turned small, hip pork-centered sandwich shop, with draft beers and outdoor patio.

posts.name: Laurelhurst Market *
posts.note: Butcher shop/steakhouse providing unusual cuts, house-cured meats and craft drinks in industrial digs.

posts.name: Le Pigeon *
posts.note: Rotating menu of creative French-inspired fare served at communal tables or the bar in a snug room.

posts.name: Lincoln Restaurant *
posts.note: Spare, polished bistro bar serving locally sourced dishes from an open kitchen. You need to order the elk if it's available.

posts.name: The Meadow
posts.note: The Meadow, salt, chocolate, bitters, and salt blocks.

posts.name: Michael's Italian Beef & Sausage Co. *
posts.note: Quick-serve destination for Chicago-style sandwiches plus Italian sausage and other casual fare such as hot dogs.

posts.name: Ned Ludd *
posts.add1: 3925 NE Martin Luther King Jr Blvd
posts.note: Inventive New American dishes cooked in wood-fired oven and served in small, elegantly rustic room. Monday night only 100 wood oven pizza's.

posts.name: Nong’s Khao Man Gai
posts.note: The namesake Khao Man Gai (Thai chicken and rice wrapped in butcher paper) draws crowds to this cart.

posts.name: Olympic Provisions *
posts.note: House-made charcuterie and European-style meals provided in an industrial space with a to-go counter.

posts.name: Podnah's Pit Barbecue *
posts.note: Smoked Texas-style barbecue and sides served in a simple, spacious restaurant with wood tables & bar. Been told you need to get a sampler platter.

posts.name: Pok Pok
posts.note: Creative Thai street food like fish-sauce wings and unique beverages served at a small, modern spot.

posts.name: Salt & Straw
posts.note: They love exploring fun, interesting new ice cream flavors and my favorite so far is the salted Carmel.
